cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest over the Yucatan, then turning north-northeast across the Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi coastline) late Wednesday, before accelerating inland toward Alabama and Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, metropolitan New Orleans and adjacent bays
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for northern Gulf Coast (warnings only in Yucatán at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to Navarre, FL including the entire Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely; a 40 % chance of at least 39 mph, and an 11 % chance of 58 mph winds. Hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks slightly east of forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC storm-surge graphic indicates 4–6 ft inundation possible from Port Fourchon, LA to Dauphin Island, AL — this includes the Mississippi coast near Pascagoula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches expected across southern Mississippi, capable of flash and urban flooding in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous surf, possible tornadoes in outer rainbands, and rapid river rises could disrupt port operations and ground transportation.
